contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Erasmus}} '''[[Desiderius Erasmus]]''' was a humanist scholar, also known as Erasmus of Rotterdam. '''Erasmus''' may also refer to: * [[Erasmus programme]], the higher education part of the European Union's Socrates programme for student exchange * [[Erasmus University]], a university in Rotterdam * [[Erasmus Prize]], an annual prize awarded by the Praemium Erasmianum Foundation * [[Erasmus Bridge]], a bridge in Rotterdam * [[Erasmus (Dune)|Erasmus (''Dune'')]], a fictional robot in the ''Legends of Dune'' series by Kevin J. Anderson and Brian Herbert * [[Erasmus (Shōgun)|''Erasmus'' (''Shōgun'')]], a fictional ship in ''Shōgun'' by James Clavell * [[Erasmus (song)|"Erasmus" (song)]], a song by You Am I from ''Dilettantes'' * [[7907 Erasmus]], a main-belt asteroid ==People with the name== * [[Erasmus of Arcadia]], Greek Orthodox bishop * [[Saint Erasmus of Formiae]] * [[Kermit Erasmus]], South African football player, currently playing for Feyenoord * [[Marais Erasmus]], South African cricket umpire * [[Alan Erasmus]], English co-founder of [[Factory Records]] Manchester * [[Erasmus Gower]], British naval officer and colonial governor * [[Erasmus Grasser]], leading sculptor in Munich during the early 16th century * [[Erasmus Alvey Darwin]], brother of Charles Darwin * [[Erasmus Darwin]], English physician, poet and grandfather of Charles Darwin * [[Erasmus James]], American professional football player * [[Erasmus D. Keyes]], businessman, banker and military general * [[Erasmus Reinhold]], German astronomer and mathematician during the early 16th century * [[Erasmus Smith]], English merchant, landowner and philanthropist in the field of education * [[Daniel Erasmus]], South African athlete * [[Frans Erasmus]], South African politician * [[Jaco Erasmus]], Italian rugby union player * [[Georges Erasmus]], Canadian politician * [[Rassie Erasmus]], South African rugby union coach and former player ===Fictional characters=== * [[Erasmus (Quest for Glory)|Erasmus (''Quest for Glory'')]], a character in the ''Quest for Glory'' adventure games * [[Erasmus B. Dragon]], A widely used humorous pseudonym or joke name ==See also== * [[Gymnasium Erasmianum]] (Erasmus Gymnasium school), Rotterdam * [[Erasmushogeschool Brussel]], Brussels * [[Erasmus Hall High School]] (originally Erasmus Hall Academy), Brooklyn, New York * [[Erasme Louis Surlet de Chokier]], prominent 19th Century Belgian politician * ''[[Erasmus Montanus]]'', a satirical play by Ludvig Holberg * [[Rasmus (disambiguation)]] * [[Rasmussen]] * [[Rasmusen]] {{disambiguation}}
